educations.schoolName: Georgia Southern University - College of Business Administration

headline: Accounting Professional
summary: Accountant with over five years of experience. Skilled at prioritizing tasks, managing scope and schedule, and meeting deadlines. Responsibilities have included: evaluating general ledger discrepancies, formulating sound recommendations to enhance the integrity and auditability of trial balances, and performing reconciliation activities to subsidiary detail with a focus on abnormal balances. Greatest accomplishment was developing and implementing policies improving the financial management system and accountability of individuals in control of agency funds.

positions.description: Provided technical and financial accounting support to the Department of Homeland Security - Immigration and Customs Enforcement using the Federal Financial Management System (FFMS), an Oracle based financial system. Updated FFMS user manuals to provide system users with guidance on entering transactions. Examined and interpreted general ledger balances and underlying transactions. Tested financial data to identify discrepancies. Retrieved and reconciled transactions to associated USSGL proprietary and budgetary accounts.
positions.title: Jr. Federal Staff Accountant

positions.description: Maintained highly sensitive and confidential patient health information. Calculated and posted adjustments of insurance payments. Delivered efficient customer service to office visitors, faculty/staff, and students. Revamped financial management system for a local non-profit organization.
positions.title: Health Services Graduate Assistant

positions.description: Obtained a thorough knowledge of the Center's chart of accounts and associated audit trails. Analyzed all financial and operational aspects of the Center to determine adherence to GAAP. Maintained and operated the Center's accounting system using QuickBooks. Generated comprehensive financial reports to capture and examine monthly expenditures. Prepared a detailed project work plan for improving the accountability and internal controls of the Center's financial funding. Provided short narratives outlining all recommendations for process improvement to Board members during monthly board meetings. Developed and presented a policy and procedure guide which corrected issues found.
positions.title: Accounting Intern

positions.description: Managed accounts payable and reconciliation duties. Ensured proper accounting procedures for purchases and employee travel expense reimbursements. Collected data for reporting and budgeting purposes. Aided with preparation for annual audits of financial statements. Supported Finance Department with accounting projects as delegated by Finance Manager.
positions.title: Accounting Intern

positions.description: Assisted staff with the preparation of financial statements and other related reports based on company procedures. Developed and maintained productive client relationships. Managed client payments and other deposits. Communicated results of consulting projects via written reports and oral presentations to senior management.
positions.title: Consultant Intern
